parameters.info: MS(s) to be imaged. If multiple mses are specified, they need to be phase-rotated to the same point on the sky
parameters.name: msname

parameters.info: Prefix for output products. Default is prefix of MS
parameters.name: prefix

parameters.info: Specify number of computing threads to use, i.e., number of cpu cores that will be used. None means use all  cores
parameters.name: threads

parameters.info: Limit memory usage to the given fraction of the total system memory. This is an approximate value.
parameters.name: mem

parameters.info: Like 'mem', but this specifies a fixed amount of memory in gigabytes.
parameters.name: absmem

parameters.info: Increase verbosity of output
parameters.name: verbose

parameters.info: Add date and time to each line in the output.
parameters.name: log-time

parameters.info: Do not output anything but errors.
parameters.name: quite

parameters.info: Force or disable reordering of Measurement Set. This can be faster when the measurement set needs to be iterated several times, such as with many major iterations or in channel imaging mode. If unspecified will only be enabled in channel imaging mode
parameters.name: reorder

parameters.info: Save model data in model data column after imaging. It can save time not to update the model data column.
parameters.name: no-update-model-required

parameters.info: Do not save the dirty image
parameters.name: no-dirty

parameters.info: Save the gridded weights in the a fits file named <image-prefix>-weights.fits.
parameters.name: saveweights

parameters.info: Calculate and apply the primary beam and save images for the Jones components, with weighting identical to the weighting as used by the imager. Only available for LOFAR.
parameters.name: apply-primary-beam

parameters.info: If a primary beam image exists on disk, reuse those images (not implemented yet)
parameters.name: reuse-primary-beam

parameters.info: Save the gridded uv plane, i.e., the FFT of the residual image. The UV plane is complex, hence two images will be output: <prefix>-uv-real.fits and <prefix>-uv-imag.fits
parameters.name: saveuv

parameters.info: Assume the visibilities have already been beam-corrected for the reference direction.
parameters.name: set-differential-lofar-beam

parameters.info: Weightmode can be: natural, uniform, briggs. Default: uniform. When using Briggs' weighting, add the robustness parameter, like: 'weight briggs 0.5'
parameters.name: weight

parameters.info: Increase the weight gridding box size, similar to Casa's superuniform weighting scheme. The factor can be rational and can be less than one for subpixel weighting.
parameters.name: superweight

parameters.info: In spectral mode, calculate the weights as if the image was made using MFS. This makes sure that the sum of channel images equals the MFS weights. Otherwise, the channel image will become a bit more naturally weighted. This is only relevant for weighting modes that require gridding (i.e., Uniform, Briggs').
parameters.name: nomfsweighting

parameters.info: Filter the weights and set high weights to the local mean. The level parameter specifies the filter level; any value larger than level*localmean will be set to level*localmean.
parameters.name: weighting-rank-filter

parameters.info: Set size of weighting rank filter
parameters.name: weighting-rank-filter-size

parameters.info: Taper the weights with a Gaussian function. This will reduce the contribution of long baselines. The beamsize is by default in asec, but a unit can be specified as '2amin'
parameters.name: taper-gaussian

parameters.info: Taper the outer weights with a Tukey transition. Lambda specifies the size of the transition; use in combination with -maxuv-l.
parameters.name: taper-tukey

parameters.info: aper the weights with a Tukey transition. Lambda specifies the size of the transition; use in combination with 'minuv-l'
parameters.name: taper-inner-tukey

parameters.info: Taper the weights with a rectangle, to keep a space of lambda between the edge and gridded visibilities.
parameters.name: taper-edge

parameters.info: Taper the edge weights with a Tukey window. Lambda is the size of the Tukey transition. When 'taper-edge' is also specified, the Tukey transition starts inside the inner rectangle.
parameters.name: taper-edge-tukey

parameters.info: Image size in pixels. List of integers (width and height) or a single integer for a square image
parameters.name: npix

parameters.info: After inversion, trim the image to the given size.
parameters.name: trim

parameters.info: Scale of a pixel. Default unit is arcsec, but can be specificied, e.g. 'scale 20asec'
parameters.name: cellsize

parameters.info: Will continue an earlier WSClean run. Earlier model images will be read and model visibilities will be subtracted to create the first dirty residual. CS should have been used in the earlier run, and model data should have been written to the measurement set for this to work
parameters.name: continue

parameters.info: Subtract the model from the data column in the first iteration. This can be used to reimage an already cleaned image, e.g. at a different resolution.
parameters.name: subtract-model

parameters.info: Splits the bandwidth and makes count nr. of images
parameters.name: channelsout

parameters.info: Use the minimum suggested w-layers for an image of the given size. Can e.g. be used to increase accuracy when predicting small part of full image.
parameters.name: nwlayers

parameters.info: Use the minimum suggested w-layers for an image of the given size. Can e.g. be used to increase accuracy when predicting small part of full image.
parameters.name: nwlayers-for-size

parameters.info: Perform inversion at the Nyquist resolution and upscale the image to the requested image size afterwards. This speeds up inversion considerably, but makes aliasing slightly worse. This effect is in most cases <1%
parameters.name: nosmallinversion

parameters.info: Kernel and mode used for gridding: kb = Kaiser-Bessel (default with 7 pixels), nn = nearest neighbour (no kernel), rect = rectangular window.
parameters.name: gridmode

parameters.info: Gridding antialiasing kernel size
parameters.name: gkernelsize

parameters.info: Oversampling factor used during gridding
parameters.name: oversampling

parameters.info: Always make the psf, even when no cleaning is performed.
parameters.name: make-psf

parameters.info: Only make psf. No other images are made.
parameters.name: make-psf-only

parameters.info: Save the gridding correction image. This shows the effect of the antialiasing filter
parameters.name: savegridding

parameters.info: Predict via a direct Fourier transform. This is slow, but can account for direction-dependent effects. This has only effect when 'mgain' is set or 'predict' is given.
parameters.name: dft-prediction

parameters.info: Apply the beam during DFT. Currently only works for LOFAR.
parameters.name: dft-with-beam

parameters.info: Specify visibility weighting modi. Affects how the weights (normally) stored in WEIGHT_SPECTRUM column are applied. Useful for estimating e.g. EoR power spectra errors. Normally one would use this in combination with 'no-normalize-for-weighting'.
parameters.name: visibility-weighting-mode

parameters.info: Disable the normalization for the weights, which makes the PSF's peak one. See 'visibility-weighting-mode'. Only useful with natural weighting.
parameters.name: no-normalize-for-weighting

parameters.info: Enable baseline-dependent averaging. The specified size is in number of wavelengths (i.e., uvw-units). One way to calculate this is with <baseline in nr. of lambdas> * 2pi * <acceptable integration in s> /(24*60*60).
parameters.name: baseline-averaging

parameters.info: Will replace every visibility by a Gaussian distributed value with given standard deviation before imaging.
parameters.name: simulate-noise

parameters.info: Default: 'I'. Possible values: XX, XY, YX, YY, I, Q, U, V, RR, RL, LR or LL (case insensitive). Multiple values can be separated with commas, e.g.: 'xx,xy,yx,yy'. Two or four polarizations can be joinedly cleaned (see '-joinpolarizations'), but this is not the default. I, Q, U and V polarizations will be directly calculated from the visibilities, which is not appropriate for telescopes with non-orthogonal feeds, such as MWA and LOFAR. The 'xy' polarization will output both a real and an imaginary image, which allows calculating true Stokes polarizations for those telescopes.
parameters.name: stokes

parameters.info: Only image the given time interval. Indices specify the timesteps, end index is exclusive.
parameters.name: interval

parameters.info: Number of intervals to image inside the selected global interval
parameters.name: intervalsout

parameters.info: Only image the given channel range. Indices specify channel indices, end index is exclusive
parameters.name: channelrange

parameters.info: Image the given field id. Default: first field (id 0)
parameters.name: field

parameters.info: Selects only the spws given in the list. list should be a comma-separated list of integers
parameters.name: spws

parameters.info: CORRECTED_DATA if it exists, otherwise DATA will be used.
parameters.name: column

parameters.info: Set maximum baseline distance
parameters.name: maxuvw-m

parameters.info: Set minimum baseline distance
parameters.name: minuvw-m

parameters.info: Set maximum uv distance
parameters.name: maxuv-l

parameters.info: Set minimum uv distance
parameters.name: minuv-l

parameters.info: Maximum number of clean iterations to perform
parameters.name: clean_iterations

parameters.info: Stopping clean thresholding in Jy
parameters.name: threshold

parameters.info: Estimate noise level using a robust estimator and stop at sigma x stddev.
parameters.name: auto-threshold

parameters.info: Construct a mask from found components and when a threshold of sigma is reached, continue cleaning with the mask down to the normal threshold.
parameters.name: auto-mask

parameters.info: Instead of using a single RMS for auto thresholding/masking, use a spatially varying RMS image
parameters.name: local-rms

parameters.info: Size of window for creating the RMS background map, in number of PSFs.
parameters.name: local-rms-window

parameters.info: Either 'rms' (default, uses sliding window RMS) or 'rms-with-min' (use max(window rms,1.5/5window min))
parameters.name: rms-background-method

parameters.info: Cleaning gain: Ratio of peak that will be subtracted in each iteration
parameters.name: gain

parameters.info: Cleaning gain for major iterations: Ratio of peak that will be subtracted in each major iteration. To use major iterations, 0.85 is a good value.
parameters.name: mgain

parameters.info: Perform cleaning by searching for peaks in the sum of squares of the polarizations, but subtract components from the individual images. Only possible when imaging two or four Stokes or linear parameters
parameters.name: joinpolarizations

parameters.info: Perform cleaning by searching for peaks in the MFS image, but subtract components from individual channels. This will turn on mfsweighting by default
parameters.name: joinchannels

parameters.info: Clean on different scales. This is a new algorithm. This parameter invokes the v1.9 multiscale algorithm, which is slower but more accurate compared to the older algorithm, and therefore the recommended one to use. The older algorithm is now invoked with 'fast-multiscale'.
parameters.name: multiscale

parameters.info: Clean on different scales. This is a new fast experimental algorithm. This method used to be invoked with 'multiscale' before v1.9, but the newer multiscale
parameters.name: fast-multiscale

parameters.info: Parameter to prevent cleaning small scales in the large-scale iterations. A higher bias will give more focus to larger scales
parameters.name: multiscale-scale-bias

parameters.info: Sets a list of scales to use in multi-scale cleaning. If unset, WSClean will select the delta (zero) scale, scales starting at four times the synthesized PSF, and increase by a factor of two until the maximum scale is reached. Example: -multiscale-scales 0,5,12.5
parameters.name: multiscale-scales

parameters.info: Use the IUWT deconvolution algorithm
parameters.name: iuwt

parameters.info: Stop IUWT when the SNR decreases. This might help limitting divergence, but can occasionally also stop the algorithm too early.
parameters.name: iuwt-snr-test

parameters.info: Set the border size in which no cleaning is performed, in percentage of the width/height of the image. With an image size of 1000 and clean border of 1%, each border is 10 pixels.
parameters.name: cleanborder

parameters.info: Use the specified fits-file as mask during cleaning.
parameters.name: fitsmask

parameters.info: Use the specified CASA mask as mask during cleaning.
parameters.name: casamask

parameters.info: Do not allow negative components during cleaning
parameters.name: nonegative

parameters.info: Stop on negative components
parameters.name: stopnegative

parameters.info: Fit a polynomial over frequency to each clean component. This has only effect when the channels are joined with 'joinchannels'
parameters.name: fit-spectral-pol

parameters.info: Decrease the number of channels as specified by 'channelsout' to the given number for deconvolution. Only possible in combination with one of the 'fit-spectral' options. Proper residuals/restored images will only be returned when mgain < 1.
parameters.name: deconvolution-channels

parameters.info: Use with 'joinchannels' to perform peak finding in the sum of squared values over channels, instead of the normal sum. This is useful for imaging QU polarizations with non-zero rotation measures, for which the normal sum is insensitive.
parameters.name: squared-channel-joining

parameters.info: Use alternative joined clean algorithm (feature for testing)
parameters.name: force-dynamic-join

parameters.info: Set a circular beam size (FWHM) in arcsec for restoring the clean components.
parameters.name: beamsize

parameters.info: Set the FWHM beam shape for restoring the clean components. Defaults units for maj and min are arcsec, and degrees for PA. Can be overriden, e.g. 'beamshape 1amin 1amin 3deg'. Default is use PSF FWHM sizes
parameters.name: beamshape

parameters.info: Determine beam shape by fitting the PSF.
parameters.name: fitbeam

parameters.info: Write the beam in output fits files as calculated from the longest projected baseline. This method results in slightly less accurate beam size/integrated fluxes, but provides a beam size without making the PSF for quick imaging.
parameters.name: theoreticbeam

parameters.info: Do not determine beam shape from the PSF
parameters.name: nofitbeam

parameters.info: Force restoring beam to be circular
parameters.name: circularbeam

parameters.info: Allow restoring beam to be elliptical
parameters.name: ellipticalbeam

parameters.info: Factor to increase the image size
parameters.name: padding

parameters.info: Number of major cycles
parameters.name: nmiter

parameters.info: list of model components from wsclean
parameters.name: savesourcelist

parameters.info: list of model components from wsclean
parameters.name: predict
